    Spatial feature overlay

    VisSpatialOverlay.Rd

    Overlay selected features onto spatial images with improved color scales.

    Usage

    VisSpatialOverlay(
  object,
  features,
  image = NULL,
  alpha = 0.8,
  coords_cols = c("x", "y"),
  point_size = 0.8,
  palette = "C"
)

    Arguments

    object

    A Seurat object; if not spatial, falls back to embedding overlay.

    features

    Character vector of gene features.

    image

    Image key; defaults to active image.

    alpha

    Point alpha.

    coords_cols

    Column names for fallback coordinates.

    point_size

    Point size for fallback scatter.

    palette

    Viridis palette option for color/fill.

    Value

    A patchwork of spatial feature plots.

    Examples

    obj <- SeuratVisProExample(n_cells = 300, n_genes = 800, n_clusters = 3, spatial = TRUE)
#> Modularity Optimizer version 1.3.0 by Ludo Waltman and Nees Jan van Eck
#> 
#> Number of nodes: 300
#> Number of edges: 12023
#> 
#> Running Louvain algorithm...
#> Maximum modularity in 10 random starts: 0.8321
#> Number of communities: 3
#> Elapsed time: 0 seconds
VisSpatialOverlay(obj, features = c('G1','G2'))
#> Error in ggplot2::geom_point(alpha = alpha, size = point_size): Problem while computing aesthetics.
#> ℹ Error occurred in the 1st layer.
#> Caused by error:
#> ! Can't subset `.data` outside of a data mask context.
